title: const
description: A constant variable (const) cannot be reassigned after initialization.

title: let
description: A variable declared with let can have its value reassigned.

title: boolean
description: A boolean data type has a value of either true or false.

title: number
description: The number data type can represent integers (whole numbers) or floating-point numbers (decimals).

title: string
description: A string is a sequence of characters enclosed in single or double quotes.

title: object
description: An object is a collection of key-value pairs, similar to a digital filing cabinet.

title: array
description: An array is an ordered list of items, where each item has an index starting from 0.
example:
const pandasShop = [ "bamboo seeds", "bamboo stalks", "bamboo leaves", "Mean Girls on VHS" ];
console.log(pandasShop[3]);
